security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only markdown documentation and example prompts. No executable code, scripts, network calls, or file system access. Safe for publication.

content.value_statement: Agentic coding fails without detailed planning. This skill provides a proven methodology for creating thorough markdown plans through iterative multi-model refinement and conversion to executable beads.
actual_capabilities: Guides users through a 5-phase planning process for software projects
Provides exact prompts for GPT Pro extended reasoning and multi-model review
Explains how to convert detailed plans into self-contained executable beads
Includes best practices for iterative plan refinement with frontier models
Documents real-world examples of successful planning workflows
Covers common mistakes and how to avoid them
limitations: This skill provides methodology and prompts, not automated code execution
Does not include tools for creating or managing project files
Requires users to manually apply prompts in their AI assistant
The quality of output depends on the AI models used for planning

use_cases.title: Plan complex projects
use_cases.description: Create detailed markdown plans for multi-file software projects before writing any code.

use_cases.title: Structure agent tasks
use_cases.description: Convert comprehensive plans into beads that AI agents can execute independently.

use_cases.title: Improve team workflows
use_cases.description: Establish planning standards that ensure consistent, high-quality project outcomes.

prompt_templates.title: Initial Plan Request
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a comprehensive markdown plan for [PROJECT NAME]. Include goals, user workflows, tech stack, architecture decisions, and detailed task breakdown with dependencies.

prompt_templates.title: Plan Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Carefully review this entire plan and propose revisions for better architecture, features, reliability, and performance. Include git-diff style changes with rationale.

prompt_templates.title: Integrate Revisions
prompt_templates.prompt: Integrate these revisions to the markdown plan in-place using ultrathink. At the end, indicate which changes you agree with, somewhat agree with, or disagree with.

prompt_templates.title: Blend Models
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze these competing plans from different models and create a hybrid plan that blends the best ideas from all sources with git-diff style changes.

output_examples.input: Help me plan a new task management web application
output: Goals: Create a collaborative task manager with real-time sync
Tech Stack: TypeScript, Next.js 16, React 19, Tailwind, Supabase
Phase 1: Database Schema and Authentication Setup

best_practices: Spend 80% of time on planning and only 20% on implementation
Use GPT Pro with Extended Reasoning for initial plan creation
Iterate through 4-5 refinement rounds until suggestions become incremental
Convert finalized plans to self-contained beads with clear dependencies
anti_patterns: Starting implementation before the plan reaches steady-state
Using a single round of review instead of iterative refinement
Creating skeleton code before having a comprehensive plan
Losing plan context by not converting to independent beads

faq.question: Which AI models work best for planning?
faq.answer: GPT Pro with Extended Reasoning excels at initial planning. Claude Opus 4.5 and Claude Code work well for integration. Gemini3 and Grok4 can provide alternative perspectives for blending.

faq.question: How long should the planning phase take?
faq.answer: Complex projects may require 2-3 hours of planning across 4-5 refinement rounds. This investment typically saves 30+ hours of rework later.

faq.question: How detailed should the final plan be?
faq.answer: Great plans are 3,500+ lines after refinement. They include user workflows, tech stack justification, architecture decisions, and granular tasks with dependencies.

faq.question: Does this skill store my data?
faq.answer: No. This skill only provides methodology and prompts. All planning work happens in your conversation with your AI assistant.

faq.question: Why use beads instead of task lists?
faq.answer: Beads are self-contained tasks with full context. Agents can execute them independently without needing access to the original plan document.

faq.question: How does this compare to simple task breakdown?
faq.answer: This methodology front-loads human intent and produces comprehensive plans that help AI models understand the entire system. Simple task lists lack context and rationale.
